threads.com:
Howdy, partner!

What you see here began as a series of comedy-centric stories with the concept of an alicorn-ascended Princess Applejack trying to change a mismanaged Equestria for the better by humorously interacting with the other, quite lazy, princesses. Plus late night pink antics.

Not to mention a whole bunch of Changelings with nothing better to do but cause mischief.


The whole thing was set in motion by this gem:

~~~~~

>So, wait, why am Ah' a princess again?

>Because you seem to be the only goddamn one of those ponies who gets that a Princess need to do actual work regarding maintenance of the kingdom. You know how much city planning or trade negotiations Twilight or Luna have done? Fucking nothing. Everyone is obsessed with the world ending threats they think I should fight, but the minute I point out the free health care I have to work to maintain everyone goes quiet. And don't even get me started on Cadence, who can't even manage a basic meeting with the Equestrian Games representative. Fucking annoying. Go do actual princess stuff, because apparently everyone else got the pamphlets mixed up or something and thinks "Princess" means "Beat cop."

~~~~~

Are you feeling creative? Try your hand at writing a story! No contribution is too small and we love having new folks around.

If you're more artistically inclined give a drawing or sketch a shot. Don't fret too much; it doesn't have to be fancy and we appreciate artwork a lot.

If that isn't your style either, writers always need feedback. So tell us what you liked - and what you didn't - to help us improve.

If you are unsure about anything, do not be afraid to ask. We will gladly bring you up-to-date or explain anything you feel is unclear.

Thread 354, and we've got turkey galore!

last_replies.com:
Anyone want a /bale/ edition of a soap making workshop thing?
When? On a friday or saturday, lets say 3pm EST - no date set yet. December sometime?
The idea is to make the simplest possible soap with the least amount of things, using things typically found around the house.

Hard Requirements:
A scale of some sort. Kitchen or shipping scale is ideal.
Lye. Pretty easily found at any hardware store or many grocery stores sold as something like "100% lye drain unclogger" or similar. Ex: https://www.homedepot.com/p/Instant-Power-Crystal-Lye-Drain-Cleaner-1650/204374017
Any kind of cooking oil thats laying around.
3 containers made of glass or stainless steel.
1 spoon
water

Recommended:
Silicon spatula
Shipping or Kitchen scale that can measure grams or fractional ounces
Freezer paper
distilled or reverse osmosis filtered water

Do not use:
Anything made of aluminum

So, anyone want to do something like this on a livestream?
What day should I do it on?

Some raised their eyebrows suggestively, some winked, others licked their lips or made lewd gestures with their tongues, still others gazed dreamily at him, while still others blew kisses. Looking down at Prosecutor X, he was met by a truly salacious, but also truly endearing grin. She was gorgeous in her black dress and ruby earrings. She jiggled his balls and gave him a wink. Then he turned to look at Miss Defender. Equally lovely in her blue dress and sapphire earrings, she beamed back at him with a sensually suggestive, but warm smile. Leaning in, she gave the tip of his penis a brief teasing lick. Looking to Judge Fluttershy, he beheld her warm, loving expression.
>"See Mister Anon? No need to be bashful!" the judge said with a laugh.
Suddenly Anon's understanding expanded and he realized something monumental. 'There IS something special going on here! Princess Luna was right! All these mares are Fluttershy! Every last one of them! Not only do they look like Fluttershy, they ARE Fluttershy; I can sense it in every fiber of my being! They are all my beloved Fluttershy! How can that be? How did this happen? How could I have missed it all this time?' was Anon's internal dialog. "Fluttershy? It's you! Isn't it?! Wha...? How is this possible? Why didn't I recognize you before?"
>Judge Fluttershy smiled in true love in response to Anon's realization. "Yes, Anon! It's me! It was so wonderful when you came into court to visit me! Um, I was really surprised, but, um, pleasantly! You've never visited before. I mean you were here sometimes, but not YOU you. It was a different, NOT REAL you."
Anon was beside himself in astonishment. He was about to speak more, but Judge Fluttershy interrupted.
>"Are you ready to ask your questions, Miss Defender." said Judge Fluttershy laughing happily.
>"Yes, your greatness. I only have one." Miss Defender responded. "Well, Mister Anon? Who-done-it?"
Anon was overcome by the novelty of seeing his wife all around him. 'This must be the beginning of the moment of clarity when I start to understand what Princess Luna said. The magical connection is between me and Fluttershy; it is the thread connects us. Where are we? Somewhere in time, space, in thought? It's just as Her Highness said. Through whatever void separates us, we have come together here and now, wherever that it!"
>"Well, Anon?" Miss Defender probed.

I left some notes but my general takeaway is that I liked the fic. It's not the most unique concept out there, sure, but looking at the amount of Luna's banishment fics that make it to the box, people don't mind seeing how different takes on the same ideas, provided the idea is good enough. And your take is pretty good, which helps.
One minor thing that I didn't find a great place to comment on is the color of the MC's and his sister's coats. There's a reason literally no regular pony in the show has a pure jet black coat. Of course, it's less jarring in a written form of content, but you might consider repainting them into a dark hue other than #000000.
Other than that, maybe you could mention that the assassin is from outside Equestria in one of his initial speeches. The fic does make that crystal clear later on, but having ponies who hail from outside the borders of Equestria is unusual enough that, in my opinion, it deserves an extra mention.

Having Celestia go full Galadriel (or Daybreaker, for a setting-appropriate comparison that I'm assuming was the intended one) is a bit unexpected but I liked it. Maybe you could consider Celestia having a bit stronger reaction to her own outburst because her dialogue afterwards does read like "oops, sorry, tbdesu kinda your fault, tho" and those long blocks of dialogue present a perfect opportunity for her to do something. I remember that you've said that you prefer to have the ponies walk during a dialogue because it's easier to add action tags there. It's certainly visible here.

And even though yeah, the other anon might be right that the ending is obvious about halfway through the fic, that isn't a problem. It's obvious because it's a good ending that makes sense for Celestia to steer the action towards. I also liked that you didn't go edgy with the fic despite the premise.

>"I'm thankful for each and everyone one of you. That no matter what each of us goes through, everypony else is there, ready to stand with them. I'm thankful for the adventures that we've shared together, for the friendship problems that we've solved together. And I'm thankful that Princess Celestia sent me here all of those years ago, so that I was able to meet all of you."
>She takes a deep breath and sits down, discarding the flashcards that had sat unused on the table.
>"Gratitude comes from your heart, no what you write down to impress you friends the night prior. I'm thankful that I got to go last, so that I was able to learn that here."
>She puffs herself out as she said this, proud of coming to that realization on her own.
>All eyes turn to you.
"I would say that I'm thankful for each one of you for making my life here easier. I know that at times I can be a bit of an asshole, but I cannot express my appreciation for each of you enough."
>Each mare gives you a pleasant smile, and the evening quickly passes as food is eaten, alcohol is drank, and a pony has to be removed from a bookshelf after trying to fly upside-down while drunk.
>Everyone thanks you for sharing your holiday with them as they leave, and you ignore the mess that Twilight's dining room has now become as you enter into the castle library.
>You recline on a large beanbag, the cheaper alternative to human-sized furnishings.
>Twilight trots in after you, and starts to speak as you sit down.
>"I also wanted to say that I'm really happy that you came into my life Anon."
>You raise your head to get a better look at her as she continues.
>"And I'm really grateful that you're willing to share so much about what your home was. I'm really sorry that you had to spend the afternoon in the kitchen by yourself, but I didn't know what else you would serve on a thanksgiving."
>You can tell that she wants to keep going, but you take this as a good moment to interject.
"I'm thankful that you care about me so much that you're willing to slap together celebrations for holidays I had back home. Not just anyone would do that for a person, you know."
>"Anypony, Anon."
"Not this time Twilight, I don't think ANYONE would go to the lengths you have."
>She blushes as you pat your lap.
>Twilight takes the invitation and hops up onto your lap, facing towards you.
>"So, was it close to what you had back on Earth Anon?"
>You pull her closer into you, and snuggle into her like a stuffed animal, and whisper into her ear.
"I think this was a lot nicer than what I had back home."
>She nuzzles into your chest, and her wings drape around your shoulders.
"I really am thankful for you Twi, and everything you've done for me here."
>"I'm thankful for you too, Anon."
>"I'm thankful for you too."

And that's all. Again, please leave whatever criticism you can, and remember I'm thankful for you, Anon.

The idea that Sunset and Applejack are as masculine as Rainbow Dash is laughable. They are much more mellow and have much more feminine traits so that their friendships with the others still feels natural, they doesn't come off as the token tomboy like Rainbow Dash does.

Rainbow Dash has the personality of a typical loud male jock and yet she is friends with feminine girls who have completely different temperaments and interests than her. She has never been shown with tomboy or male friends that have her type of temperament. She comes off as a forced token tomboy character. Like really, they couldn't give her a single male friend? She has the masculine temperament of guys, so it seems like she would have definitely have male friends. Heck, she acts a lot more like your average male than your average female.

Where are her friends that are not vastly different from her? I'm not even necessarily asking for the same interests, just for a similar temperment. The rest of them are all chill normies in spite of varying interests while Rainbow is just alone as the loud brash hyper dude bro. And yet she magically is on the same footing as the rest as best friends, and appears to have no other close friends. If you had a jock friend who acted like Rainbow Dash but is a male, would you be able to see them as best friends with people with the mane six's temperment? Of course not.

In a real life setting like high school or college, what group of people could you more naturally see Rainbow Dash hanging out and bonding with: A group of brash, mascaline troublemakers (whether male or tomboys) who are athletic and enjoy screwing around, or the feminine safe mane six? You know the answer to this question deep down in spite of all the mental gymnastics you use to deny it. The Mane Six are too attitudinally safe and unfun for her. Her placement in the show is forced and has always been forced. But people don't care because they like tomboys. Which is fair enough, but you still gotta acknowledge this blatant flaw even if it does not personally bother you.

What is a 'Satyr Abomination' thread about?
A satyr is what happens when a human and a pony decide to get freaky and end up having a child. The top half is mostly human, the bottom is from pony mom (or pony dad). This thread is dedicated to the art and written works about these lovable creatures.
>What about other species?
The show had quite a few different intelligent species by season 8, 'everycreature' and all. Pick your poison, but /mlp/ is mainly into ponies.
>What is the world/characters/personalities & attributes?

Welcome to the Pony Voice Preservation Project!
youtu.be/730zGRwbQuE

The Pony Preservation Project is a collaborative effort by /mlp/ to build and curate pony datasets for as many applications in AI as possible.

Technology has progressed such that a trained neural network can generate convincing voice clips, drawings and text for any person or character using existing audio recordings, artwork and fanfics as a reference. As you can surely imagine, AI pony voices, drawings and text have endless applications for pony content creation.

AI is incredibly versatile, basically anything that can be boiled down to a simple dataset can be used for training to create more of it. AI-generated images, fanfics, wAIfu chatbots and even animation are possible, and are being worked on here.

Any anon is free to join, and there are many active tasks that would suit any level of technical expertise. If you’re interested in helping out, take a look at the quick start guide linked below and ask in the thread for any further detail you need.

EQG and G5 are not welcome.

derpy.me/FDnSk

threads.com:
This will be deleted so it'll be quick. Today's an exceptionally special day as it marks 10 years since Milky Way's Tumblr started. The tumblr is now age-restricted but you can view the posts here starting from the back: https://www.tumbex.com/milkmare-of-trottingham.tumblr/posts?page=10

Milky's special talent quickly gained the blog over 1400 watchers in less than two weeks. It was especially embraced on /mlp/ where the thread generated several times more content than the tumblr which was only in its second day: https://desuarchive.org/mlp/thread/5678650/#q5678650 Milky had a continuous presence for months afterwards as a general thread.

Fast forward to May 2013 and it was on its 71st general thread: https://desuarchive.org/mlp/thread/10866090/#q10866090 The thread was deleted early and the incident shrugged off, but unbeknownst to them it was right before some of the most eventful days in /mlp/ history. Lauren Faust would visit /mlp/ a few days later https://desuarchive.org/mlp/chunk/10902082/ and all hell broke loose, even prompting a reply from Moot (https://desuarchive.org/mlp/chunk/10902082/500/3/#q10906860). But attention quickly turned to "The Scruffening", a mass deletion of various threads and general confusion over the following days. Milky Way threads were quickly deleted from then on, later confirmed as bannable content due to its NSFW nature: https://desuarchive.org/q/thread/640332/#q641855 Some claimed that Lauren's visit sparked the sudden SFW enforcement but this remains inconclusive.

Milky Way threads have occasionally been posted over the years, lasting only a few minutes to several hours at a time. While the blog's creator remains active (https://twitter.com/FlashEquestria), the blog itself hasn't had a new post in a year.

Not expecting a discussion here. This one's for the archives.

In Ponepaste, it says "File Size: 1000/1000Kb", but the limit is actually 900 KB = odd.

Looking at this paste later, I saw that it is less than 20,000 lines. However, it was a small amount less than 900 KB. IMO it's weak that Ponepaste has this limit. It should be at least 1024 KB (size of paste when viewed as raw plain text). Some textboard threads are approximately 1010 KB, and textboards are old as that fake ass 9-11/WTC thing that happened in 2001.

The html is required so there are lines. It does not matter if there are line numbers or not. If you just start adding div/span/etc then it just keeps the line flowing. Yes I know it is possible to add forced line breaks, but its ugly. Also line numbers help a lot during reading. One can just remember the line number where to continue from. And you can also link to lines. It is a list for this reason.

Goblins can be dangerous. But in the open, with only two of them, without any special magic or equipment, and with no option for them to take you by surprise, they can only be as dangerous as stray dogs. If anything, it’s more important you make sure there’s no more of them nearby, but there’s barely any place to hide around you. Only small and scattered groves of trees in these parts. But before anything else…

“Bloodhooves?” You utter quizzically. “Lady Fen Flower, you hid to me that you earned yourself a villainous tittle.”
“That’s new to me too.” The giant mare glances back with a smirk, but only a second so as not to let the two goblins without surveillance. “Hey, why are you calling me Bloodhooves?”
“We know!” one of the goblin replies. “We were there! Pinhooves fight Sparkteeth, and Bloodhooves punish all! Make them red paste!”
“We no fight!” The other says. “Me Pinhoof. She Sparkteeth. We friends! No need for paste!”
“It sounds like you’re a punishing deity to them, Fen Flower.” Silver Willow notes. “Were you pursuing that during the quest that opposed you to goblins?”
“Well… not really.” She shrugs. “I didn’t think there were enough of them left to get me any reputation at all, to be honest.”

“Hey, you two.” You address the two tiny mares. “Who are you working for? You aren’t the only of your kind to search this place, are you?”
“Only us! Only us! Saw nopony else!” One of them retorts. “Left tribe, left red paste behind! We new friendship between Pinhooves and Sparkteeth!”
“Really?” You ponder. “Then, do you know anything about this place?”
“No, Find on way!” The other answers. “We travel! Search new home… So we search stuff. Was collapsed on way, nopony, but maybe things inside.”
“Yes!” The other adds. “M-maybe food…”
“Searching stuff, uh?” You raise an eyebrow. “Can you show us what you found?”

The two goblins exchange a worried look, and proceed to empty the content of their bag for you to see.
They show you some metal arrowheads, a bear trap, a crock pot and three knives of different length, all darkened by ashes. If those indeed come from the burnt cabin, it could have been a refuge for hunters before.

“Did you find the remain of anypony in there?” Pear Plum asks, now that she has come close enough.
“No bones.” One greenskin replies. “No kill, not us, not fire, please no paste!”
“We should let them go.” Pear Plum states. “I don’t think they’ll be of any trouble for us.”

“Mmh… Before we decide…” You turn to the goblins again. “Do you know anything about the ents that roam these hills?”
“Eh…Ents?”
“Big tree ponies that walk.” You explain. “As big as Bloodhooves.”
“No.” They shake their heads. “No see any Bloodhooves trees.”

>What do?
